crude.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: not exact or without any detail, but generally correct and useful
crude.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a crude estimate of the population available for work
crude.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill
crude.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: offensive or rude, especially in a sexual way
crude.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: crude oil, rubber etc is in its natural or raw condition before it is treated with chemicals
crude.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: oil that is in its natural condition, as it comes out of an oil well, before it is made more pure or separated into different products
crude.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: crude oil, sugar etc is in a natural condition, before it has been treated in an industrial process
crude.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The level of income at which people receive Income Support  (=receive money from the government because they are poor) is widely accepted as a crude measure of the ‘poverty line’.
crude.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: crude figures have been found by simply counting the numbers of something, without considering things which may affect the numbers
crude.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: a crude analysis of how often different socio-economic groups visit a dentist or doctor
crude.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: a fall in the price of crude
